PreparerFirmName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: TYLER SIMMS & ST SAUVEUR CPA PC

IRS990.MissionDesc: KIMBALL UNION ACADEMY PREPARES STUDENTS FOR THE CHALLENGES OF TOMORROW'S WORLD BY INSPIRING ACADEMIC MASTERY, CREATIVITY, RESPONSIBILITY, AND LEADERSHIP.
IRS990.Desc: PRIVATE HIGH SCHOOL THAT SERVES 248 BOARDING STUDENTS AND 94 DAY STUDENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: KIMBALL UNION ACADEMY USES THEIR ENDOWMENT FUNDS FOR ACADEMICS, THE EQUESTRIAN PROGRAM, DEPARTMENT MANAGER SALARIES, FINANCIAL AID, BUILDING MAINTENANCE, BOOKS, AND OPERATING SUPPORT.
FINANCIAL AID ADDITION TO GROSS UP TUITION -3,962,003. INTEREST RATE SWAP -1,316,946. COST OF GOODS SOLD 207,249. ROUNDING 1.
FINANCIAL AID 3,962,003. PROVISION FOR DOUBTFUL PLEDGES 71,905. UNAMORTIZED BOND ISSUANCE COSTS 219,837.

KIMBALL UNION ACADEMY'S NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY IS PUBLISHED ON ITS WEBSITE, ON ITS APPLICATION AND EMPLOYMENT DOCUMENTS, AND IN EMPLOYMENT ADS. THE NONDISCRIMINATORY POLCY IS ALSO INCLUDED IN OUR ADMISSIONS MATERIALS, INCLUDING OUR APPLICATION FOR ADMISSION. EVERY STUDENT HAS AN ANNUAL CONTRACT WITH THE SCHOOL THAT CLEARLY STATES THE SCHOOL'S NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY.
THE NAMES AND ADDRESSES OF THE RECIPIENTS ARE AVAILABLE AT BUSINESS OFFICE OF KIMBALL UNION ACADEMY.
HOUSING IS PROVIDED TO A MAJORITY OF THE FACULTY, TO THE EXTENT ON-CAMPUS HOUSING IS AVAILABLE, IN ORDER FOR THE FACULTY TO FULFILL THEIR LOCO PARENTIS RESPONSIBILITIES.

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.TransactionDesc: GAYLE SCHAFER, AN EMPLOYEE OF THE SCHOOL, IS THE WIFE OF THE HEAD OF THE SCHOOL, MICHAEL J. SCHAFER.
BARBARA POLLARD, AN EMPLOYEE OF THE SCHOOL, IS THE WIFE OF THE SCHOOL'S DIRECTOR OF DEVELOPMENT, GREG POLLARD.
MR. FERGUSON SOLD HIS 14.29% INTEREST IN A REAL ESTATE LLC FOR FAIR MARKET VALUE BASED UPON AN APPRAISAL.
EILEEN WILLIAMS, AN EMPLOYEE OF THE SCHOOL, IS THE WIFE OF THE SCHOOL'S ASSISTANT HEAD OF SCHOOL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S GIFTS OF STOCK ARE TRANSFERRED TO A BROKERAGE HOUSE FOR IMMEDIATE SALE. REAL ESTATE GIFTS NOT CORE TO THE MISSION OF THE ACADEMY ARE PLACED WITH A QUALIFIED, LOCAL REAL ESTATE BROKER AND PLACED FOR SALE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE INDEPENDENT AUDITORS REVIEW THE FORM 990 WITH THE ORGANIZATION'S AUDIT COMMITTEE IN DETAIL. THE AUDIT COMMITTEE CHAIR THEN BRIEFS THE BOARD ON THE KEY ELEMENTS OF THE FORM 990 AND PROVIDES THE BOARD MEMBERS WITH A COPY OF THE FORM 990 PRIOR TO ITS FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION REQUIRES EACH TRUSTEE, PRIOR TO TAKING A POSITION ON THE BOARD, TO SUBMIT IN WRITING ANY POSSIBLE CONFLICTS. THE ORGANIZATION REQUIRES EACH TRUSTEE TO UPDATE THE LISTS ANNUALLY. TRUSTEES HAVING A FINANCIAL INTEREST IN THE TRANSACTION AT HAND ARE NOT ALLOWED TO VOTE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION HAS A COMPENSATION COMMITTEE. THE COMMITTEE HIRES A THIRD-PARTY EXPERT TO REVIEW, BENCHMARK, AND ASSIST IN THE NEGOTIATION OF THE HEAD'S CONTRACT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST ONLY.
